entry.title: on compilers and interpreters
entry.content:
i've lately started to become interested more and more in compilers, interpreters and programming language design overall... so this is a collection of stuff i've found (and mostly still have to read :< ).. maybe it'll be of use to someone :D ..

i don't plan to include links to docs and such, because it's trivial, but i do plan to update the list as i find more stuff

LLVM

  • Discussion on HN with various tutorials posted
  • Creating a working compiler with LLVM (Part 2)
  • Architecture of open source applications: LLVM
  • Kaleidoscope implementation with LLVM-C
  • LLVM Backend Design (GHC)
  • The LLVM Compiler Framework and Infrastructure
  • Life on an instruction in LLVM

Virtual Machines

  • Learning with Terror VM
  • Virtual Machines for Programming Languages
  • Sol - A sunny little virtual machine
  • Fast enough VMs in fast enough times

LISP

  • How to write a lisp interpreter in Python
  • How to write an even better lisp interpreter in Python

stay tuned

PS: this is on github so you can actually fork an contribute to this list, how cool is that?

PPS: thanks to @Bronsa_ for helping me when i'm just too stupid to grasp some stuff :P
